summary: The 'Delivering for Rural Seniors Act of 2025' amends the Agriculture and Consumer Protection Act of 1973. It establishes a pilot grant program to facilitate home delivery of commodities for low-income elderly participants in the Commodity Supplemental Food Program. The bill authorizes funding for grants awarded to State agencies, which then distribute funds to eligible entities for transportation, staffing, and outreach related to home delivery. The program prioritizes rural areas and requires reports on project effectiveness and best practices. It authorizes $10 million annually from 2026-2028.
